Ice::

Even in her sleep, she heard Lunarpine. She was dreaming of sparring 
with him as in the old days. She smiled. In her dream, he stood up 
and said to her, "Don't be afraid Wing. I didn't risk spark and limb 
to save you just to see you brought down by a flu bug, we'll get you 
through this I promise." She couldn't help but smile.  She knew that 
he meant it. 

She awoke a little while later. She yawned and stretched and stood 
up. She looked around the lab and wondered where she was allowed to 
go in the base. She hoped she would ba able to find something to do. 
Being a big bear cooped up in one room for days on end was not her 
idea of fun. She looked around and thought to Veratis, "What am I to 
do now? What will happen with these new modes that I have?"

She felt a tickle in her nose and she sneezed. But in doing so, she 
changed from polar bear into her halfling form.  She looked up at her 
wings and sighed. "This is going to drive me bonkers. What good is 
this half form going to accomplish, other than instill fear into 
other for not knowing what I am." Then the thought entered her mind. 
She had three forms. No one but they knew this. She could approach a 
bot in one form and attack in another. She could also get cought or 
captured in one form and then use another form to escape. She was 
finally seeing the possabilities of her new body. She smiled and 
chuckled to herself. "Oh wouldn't those preds get a big suprize if 
they ever saw me again." she chuckled. She almost wanted to go into 
battle, just to see thier reaction to her changing.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Veratis spoke openly to Lunarpine as if Ice weren't there. There 
was no
> sense trying to hide anything from her. He knew that her telepathic 
powers
> weren't in her control. "We have to find a way to control this. 
Right now
> she's on the verge of either insanity or corruption." He feared for 
her if
> she ever deciced to use this power improperly. "I'll work with her 
but
> you'll have to help too." He turned back to Ice. "Rest for now 
young one,
> you have alot of hard work ahead of you."
> 
> Lunarpine watched as Ice fell asleep. He could still hear her voice 
rambling
> on in a tired, half asleep dilogue. He moved closer to her and 
placed a hand
> on her head. "Don't be afraid Wing. I didn't risk spark and limb to 
save you
> just to see you brought down by a flu bug, we'll get you through 
this I
> promise." He started out the door but felt the urge to stop. He 
turned back
> as if to say something. "Just wait till our next match, we'll see 
just what
> your new form can do." He knew ?Veratis could only hear his 
thoughts if Ice
> broadcast them to him.
